newsitem.title: USA: Michaels January same-store sales down.
newsitem.headline: Michaels January same-store sales down.

text.p: Michaels Stores Inc said Tuesday its same-store sales for January 1997 dropped 1.0 percent from the comparable five week period in 1996.
It said sales in January 1997 were up 23 percent to $138.1 million from $111.9 million a year ago.

For the fourth quarter of fiscal year 1996 ending February 1, 1997, it said sales rose 8.0 percent to $493.7 million from $456.7 million in the previous year. Same-store sales for the quarter increased three percent.
Total sales for fiscal year 1996 were up six percent to $1.38 billion from $1.29 billion in fiscal 1995, it said. Same store sales for the year declined 1.0 percent, it said.

Michael Rouleau, chief executive officer, said that as part of a plan to strengthen the company it has sold off nearly all the furniture that is not a part of its ongoing merchandise strategy. He said the company also sold off significant quantities of inventory not needed at this time.
"Also, rather than carry over excess Christmas merchandise, I made the decision to sell it off so that we could get off to a fresh start in 1997," he said.
